recipesJson.name: Cliché

recipesJson.description:
Another fucking strawberry cream.

reviews.text: Yummy! I did switch the VBIC to LB VIC. Thanks.

I had hard time with this recipe. I love FA Forrest Mix but I'm getting a dank/swampy off-note, i'm guessing it's the mix with the VBIC/Fresh Cream. Although separately, in different mixes, I like both those flavours. I am not rating because it seems most people like it and this may just be my palate.
This is a delicious berries and cream.  Maybe my favorite.

Tastes like a raspberry creamsaver, like said below. Nice change from all the S&C recipes I have made. I would recommend mixing this. It's a very good recipe. If you want a GREAT recipe, then mix God Milk!

Finally mixed this up after getting the flavors and forgetting for a while and damn this is great!! Very much like a mix between strawberry and raspberry creamsavers.  I also mixed up God Milk and unfortunately still don't care for dragonfruit or TFA strawberry, but this recipe is right up my alley. Well done.

As one of those people that have trouble tasting strawberry, and yet love strawberry vapes... This recipe is amazing. I have long been a fan of FA Forest Fruit and love it in most berry vapes. I try everything after a mix and each day there after. This seems to be best from 4 days on, the Raspberry Sweet calms down around day 3 and things start coming fully together around day 4 and beyond. Glad I mixed a 100mL of this
This recipe is dope.  The name and description are kind of ironic imo - this isn't your regular ole strawberries and cream.  The mixed berry flavor really comes through in a great way.

This has become a regular flavor in my rotation, friends love it as well. The raspberry and forrest mix give it a great additional berry with some citrus back notes that blend very well with the strawberries and cream base. The forrest fruit is not overwhelming but sits just right within the recipe.

I think Skiddz just created this to fill out his line with a popular standard, but this is probably the best take on strawberry milk I've ever tried.  This is a regular for me, often getting mixed up with other fruits.
